decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's plans with cards like Mystical Dispute, Thought Erasure, and Casualties of War, while generating card advantage and value with cards like Narset, Parter of Veils, Tamiyo, Collector of Tales, and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly to play powerful threats like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Hydroid Krasis, and create a powerful board presence with Shark Typhoon. Overall, the deck focuses on out-valuing and outlasting the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful threats while ramping up to powerful late-game plays. By using cards like Thought Erasure to disrupt the opponent's game plan and efficient threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis to create value, the deck aims to outlast and outvalue its opponents. Nissa, Who Shakes the World provides additional ramp and can quickly close out games with her ultimate ability. The focus is on efficient control and powerful finishers to secure victory.

The main goal of this Sultai Control deck is to maintain control of the game by disrupting opponents' strategies with removal spells like Heartless Act and Eliminate, as well as disruption cards such as Thought Erasure and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck also aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Nissa, Who Shakes the World in order to cast powerful spells like Casualties of War and Shark Typhoon. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and overpowering opponents with versatile spells and efficient threats.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with aggressive creatures like Fervent Champion and Lazotep Reaver, then using Winota, Joiner of Forces to cheat out powerful creatures like Basri's Lieutenant and Knight of the Ebon Legion. Judith, the Scourge Diva provides additional damage and synergy with sacrificing creatures like Woe Strider. Combining these aggressive creatures with powerful equipment like Embercleave allows for fast and lethal attacks. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless stream of creatures and finish them off with swift, impactful attacks.

This deck focuses on using powerful control spells like Thought Erasure, Narset, and Extinction Event to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up mana with Uro and Cultivate. The main win conditions are Hydroid Krasis and Casualties of War, which provide card advantage and board control respectively. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal spells, while also generating massive threats with cards like Uro and Nissa. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's three-color requirements and ensure consistent access to all necessary colors.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on using powerful creatures like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath alongside a range of removal and disruption spells to control the game and outvalue opponents. The deck aims to ramp up with cards like Cultivate and Nissa, Who Shakes the World, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thought Erasure and Casualties of War. The deck's win condition is often closing out the game with large Shark Typhoons or overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and board presence.

This deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Teferi, Master of Time to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It also includes removal spells like Extinction Event, Casualties of War, and Eliminate to deal with threats. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with cards like Fabled Passage and Cultivate, allowing for big plays with Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. It also includes disruption with cards like Thought Erasure and Aether Gust to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on playing cheap and efficient spells to quickly pump up creatures like Sprite Dragon and Stormwing Entity to deal damage quickly. Utilizing cards like Riddleform and Dreadhorde Arcanist to maintain card advantage and tempo, while also disrupting opponent's plays with counterspells like Unsubstantiate and tempo plays like Unsummon. The deck aims to win fast by overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing the UR color combination to maximize efficiency and versatility in combat and spell-slinging.

This deck focuses on quickly playing creatures and using adventure spells to generate card advantage and tempo. By utilizing Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck is able to ramp quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Beanstalk Giant and Lovestruck Beast. The inclusion of Escape to the Wilds allows for even more card advantage and the ability to play multiple threats in a single turn. Aether Gust is included to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Brazen Borrower and Fae of Wishes provide flexibility and additional disruption.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board presence and pressure the opponent with aggro creatures, while also utilizing the Adventure mechanic to generate card advantage and tempo. The deck includes a variety of powerful Adventure creatures such as Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast, along with support cards like Lucky Clover to double the effect of Adventure spells. Additionally, the inclusion of Escape to the Wilds allows the player to refill their hand and maintain pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly and aggressively controlling the board while utilizing sacrifice mechanics for additional value. By utilizing cards like Claim the Firstborn and Priest of Forgotten Gods, the player can take control of their opponent's creatures and sacrifice them for their own benefit. Mayhem Devil and Woe Strider provide additional synergy with sacrificing creatures, dealing damage to the opponent while generating value. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and resource management, utilizing key cards like Rankle, Master of Pranks and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger for additional disruption and pressure.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up mana resources using green cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Paradise Druid, while also disrupting the opponent's plays with counterspells like Negate and Mystical Dispute. The key strategy is to play aggressive creatures like Nightpack Ambusher and Brineborn Cutthroat to apply pressure on the opponent early on, while having backup plans with powerful cards like Hydroid Krasis and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath. The deck also includes a selection of versatile spells like Aether Gust and Brazen Borrower to maintain control of the battlefield.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful planeswalkers like Tamiyo and Narset. It also ramps up with cards like Cultivate and Nissa to get ahead on mana, while Uro and Hydroid Krasis provide card advantage and life gain. The deck aims to answer threats efficiently while generating value and ultimately out-valuing the opponent with powerful spells and card advantage engines. The mana base is built to support the three-color strategy and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors for casting spells.

The main focus of the deck is to maintain control over the game through various spells and abilities. Utilizing cards like Thought Erasure, Extinction Event, Casualties of War, and Aether Gust, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while ramping up with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Cultivate to generate mana and draw cards. Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis serve as win conditions and provide additional value throughout the game. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent to secure victory.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on ramping up mana with cards like Nissa, Who Shakes the World and Cultivate, while also disrupting opponents with counterspells like Sinister Sabotage and removal spells like Heartless Act. The deck aims to control the game through card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Master of Time, and finish off opponents with powerful threats like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Hydroid Krasis. The deck also includes board wipes and versatile removal spells to handle a variety of threats effectively.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize Winota's ability to put multiple creatures into play from the top of the library and trigger their enter-the-battlefield effects, creating a powerful aggro board presence. The deck includes sacrifice outlets like Priest of Forgotten Gods and Woe Strider to enable recurring value, as well as ways to protect Winota such as Selfless Savior. Claim the Firstborn can also disrupt the opponent's board while providing additional triggers for Winota. Overall, the strategy focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a combination of speed, synergy, and value.
